meanings.sent1: She carefully unpegs the clothes from the line.
meanings.sent2: He unpegs the tent stakes before packing up the camping gear.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel unpegs all the notes from the bulletin board.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, nature unpegs its vibrant colors from the sky.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unpegs the painting from the easel.

meanings.definition: To release or loosen pegs from (something)
meanings.sent1: The gardener unpegs the tangled vines from the fence.
meanings.sent2: He unpegs the stuck door by tapping it gently.
meanings.sent3: The magician unpegs the cards from each other with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: The wind unpegs the leaves from the branches, scattering them across the yard.
meanings.sent5: She unpegs the tangled necklace from the jewelry box, careful not to break the chain.
